video.title: Node.js / Express Course - Build 4 Projects
video.description:
Node.js and Express.js are popular technologies used for JavaScript backend web development. In this course, you will improve your skills by building four projects using Node and Express.

💻 Code: https://github.com/john-smilga/node-express-course

🔗 Full Node and Express Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Oe421EPjeBE

✏️ Course developed by John Smilga. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMZFwxv5l-XtKi693qMJptA
🔗 Other projects and courses from John: https://www.johnsmilga.com/

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:02:59) Project 1: Task Manager
⌨️ (3:07:21) Project 2: Store API
⌨️ (5:05:43) Project 3: JWT Basics
⌨️ (6:28:34) Project 4: Jobs API

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 AppWrite

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: awonugba seun
topLevelComment.text:
for those that might struggle with 2:16:22, the task manager project
You cant see your db values on the browser

do this 

change  line 12 -14 inside try and catch from this 
const {data: { tasks }} = await axios.get("/api/tasks")
to this 
const response = await axios.get("/api/tasks");
This will help you log out your response, so you will be rest assured you are actually getting a response value

next thing go to he catch block line 49 or so and log out the error, so you will know the error you are getting

share your response and the  error

topLevelComment.author: azul trick
topLevelComment.text: Putting this here in case anyone struggles to understand why the error handling middleware is being used instead of the 'not found' middleware, despite the 'not found' middleware is defined before the error handling middleware. It seems that, if you call 'next' passing an error as argument, the code prioritize error handling middlewares, and it recognize them by the signature, since they have four arguments. The guy hasn't pointed it out so I had to figure it out myself, so maybe this can be of help for someone.

replies.author: Arif
replies.text: I  had a similar issue where I had an extra bracket before (req,res), so make sure it is written as "async (req,res){ } ;" , and not  "async ((req,res)=>{ });"

replies.text: When you are creating methods like, createTask in Task controller, use "async" before (req, res). Then only you can use await.

topLevelComment.author: Kowshik kumar

Hi,  i have a doubt... 
may i know why did you remove asyncWrapper function in 4-store-api project, isn't a good practice?

replies.author: Sanskar Pandey
replies.text: There is no need for the asyncWrapper function, since he's using the 'express-async-errors' package to avoid using the try/catch blocks on each of the controllers. The point of the asyncWrapper function was to avoid the repetitive usage of try/catch block on each of the controllers, but if the 'express-async-errors' package handles it for you automatically, asyncWrapper is unnecessary. Hope this helps.

DeprecationWarning: Mongoose: `findOneAndUpdate()` and `findOneAndDelete()` without the `useFindAndModify` option set to false are deprecated for 2:15:22. Mongoose version 6.14.14.

topLevelComment.author: Side Hustle Discovery
topLevelComment.text:
Man, the times that we're living in today, are simply *AMAZING!* 
Folks, we're the furthest we have ever been from, let's say.. the year 1930, literally! 🤪
If you're not taking action, and working to "move the needle" from one _tax bracket_ *up* to another, and you leave this world broke, well.. that *blood is on your own hands!* 

You have no one to blame, in this day and age, but yourself, because honestly the resources & opportunities are absolutely out there _(this being one of the top examples!)_  from all your hard work! It's all coming, keep up the hard work, stay consistent and *_keep swinging!_* *_You've got this!_*

_To the creators,_
_Beau & John_ - *Thank You!* 
_Content like this actually changes lives_ of those who realize the *value* within it and *take action!* 
Again, _thanks, men!_

- Adam M.
*Founder | Side Hustle Discovery*

replies.author: David Feldman
replies.text:
At a glance, it looks like about half of the sections from that course are now up on youtube.  Although, the last section he released on the udemy course is a full e-commerce api, and has a TON of content.  

In other words, you can now do the first half of the course for free, and if you like it, you can go get the udemy course which I highly recommend.  And it looks like he plans on releasing even more for the course in the future.
